subject: Design
title: Batch Processing: No Interface at All
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Batch Processing: No Interface at All.

hook.text: In the 1950s, you didn't use a computer. You handed your job to an operator and waited.

buildup.text: Programs were submitted as card decks. The machine processed batches overnight.

discovery.text: Results came back the next morning â€” on paper. A typo meant waiting another full day.

twist.text: Programmers spent more time waiting than working. The interface was literally a queue.

climax.text: The frustration with batch processing drove the invention of interactive computing.

punchline.text: The worst interface inspires the best one.
